attributes.action: Call upon Network Rail, Northern Rail, GMPTE and Trafford Council to work together to improve services and promote the station.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Trafford Park Station lies on the Liverpool to Manchester railway. Despite its name, the station is located in Stretford, about half a mile to the north of the town centre.
It provides a reasonable service at peak-times with trains running half-hourly in both directions. It is valued by the many commuters who use it and also by students of the next-door Trafford College technology centre. 

The station is less utilised by shoppers and part-time workers, as during off peak times most of the local trains are not timetabled to stop there. This wastes a valuable resource to a densely populated area of Stretford. There is no promotion of the station with no directional signs to it. The station’s name is confusing as it is not located in Trafford Park and no longer provides access to that area.

We call upon GMPTE, Northern Rail, Network Rail and Trafford Council to work together:

• To provide a Sunday Service
• To provide a full commuter service throughout the off peak period 
• To promote the station through better signage, lighting and consulting residents on a change of name for the station to better reflect its vicinity.
